H0.text: Increases is the change in pressure that occurs when more gas is added to a rigid container.

H1.text: Occurs is what happens to the pressure when more gas is added to a rigid container.

H2.text: Changes is what happens to the pressure when more gas is added to a rigid container.

H3.text: Higher is the pressure that results when additional gas is added to a rigid container.

A4.text: If the temperature and volume remain constant, then the pressure of the gas changes is directly proportional to the number of molecules of gas present.

A5.text: With the addition of Avogadro's law, the combined gas law develops into the ideal gas law: P V = n R T
